text.p: SKOPJE, April 1 - These are the leading stories in the Skopje press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and cannot vouch for their accuracy.

- First auditing results for TAT savings house show that out of total liabilities of 112 million German marks, 62 million represent the principal and the rest interest rates. Republican public prosecutor Stevan Pavlevski said he would no longer keep silent about the persons involved in the scandal.

- There were 1,337 registered drug addicts in Macedonia in 1995 according to official statistics. Children between 13 and 14 have already started using drugs in Macedonia, say participants of conference on drugs in Macedonia.
- Foreign Minister Ljubomir Frckoski to ask U.N. Human Rights commission in Geneva for Macedonia to be excluded from the mandate of special envoy Elisabeth Rehn.
- Macedonian foreign ministry delegation in Russia invites Russian Foreign Minister Evgeny Primakov to visit Macedonia.
- Macedonian construction minister Jorgo Sundovski to resign on Tuesday. He said he is "deeply hurt by false accusations of his involvment in the TAT scandal".
- Leadership of the ruling SDAM to hold special session on the responsibility of the party members in the TAT scandal. -- Mircela Casule, Skopje newsroom +389 91 201196
